item.title: Bins being stored on public highway, 7th January
item.description:
Adam House residents have taken to storing their domestic waste on the public highway (pavement). Planning stipulates they should be using their bin store that was created when permission for flats was given.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kent House Road, Penge, Greater London

item.title: Garden waste being dumped behind Birdsall house, 7th January
item.description:
Hi for the past year, people have been dumping garden waste in the back garden of flat 1-5 Birdsall house, in between adventure playground, behind the new flats and in front of back yards of flat 1-5 Birdsall house

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Estate Road, East Dulwich, Greater London

item.title: No grit on the path, 7th January
item.description:
On Monday the 5th of Jan me and my son who’s in a pushchair was walking down this road (see photo) and slipped on ice, there was no grit anywhere to be seen. This is a footpath that lots of people use as there is a train station by ( st Mary’s cray) I had slipped on the ice and pulled down the pushchair as I went down, this is SO dangerous I was very lucky I had still had hold of my pushchair because if if I hadn’t my son would of rolled all the way down the hill, I dread to think what could of happened to him

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Approach, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Request: Icy Pavements Creating Safety Risk in Bexley Area, 7th January
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to raise an urgent safety concern regarding the condition of pavements in the Bexley area during the current winter weather. Most pavements are currently frozen, particularly along the route from Huntington Close to Old Bexley Church of England School. The situation is especially dangerous near the road crossing with yellow tactile blister paving, where the pavement slopes downward and becomes extremely slippery when icy. This morning, while walking my son to school, we nearly slipped onto the road due to the ice on the pavement. Had there been oncoming traffic at the time, this could have resulted in a serious accident. The risk is heightened for children, parents, elderly pedestrians, and individuals with disabilities or visual impairments who rely on tactile paving for safe navigation. I kindly request that this area be addressed as soon as possible by spreading grit or salt on the pavements and crossings to reduce the risk of injury and ensure pedestrian safety during the winter season. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I would appreciate confirmation once the issue has been resolved. Yours faithfully, Roshni D'Silva

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, North Cray Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 wheelie bins and food waste left on pavement Cottage Field Close opposite 24 - 25, 7th January
item.description:
There is a white lidded bin a blue lidded and a brown food waste bin. they have been left on the pavement for about 6 weeks now and no one has claimed them. They do not have any numbers on them and need removing as they are blocking the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Cottage Field Close, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: CCTV or BT cabinet knocked over, 7th January
item.description:
Cables exposed, cabinet lying across pavement potentially hazardous to pedestrians. Prior to this incident cabinet already in poor condition with doors that do not close fully. Needs to be replaced with a new cabinet and/or relocated to a more suitable location that is not as vulnerable to being knocked over. Openreach claim it is not their equipment, difficult to identify who else to contact hence notifying RBG.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Norman Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
